bibl.title: Abstract: Suggestions for Developing a Campaign to Control Yellow Fever, by Michael E. Connor, 1924

div1.p: Connor's article concerns yellow fever control by an anti-mosquito campaign.

div1.head: Abstract: Suggestions for Developing a Campaign to Control Yellow Fever, by Michael E. Connor, 1924
div1.p:
Connor, M.E.: Suggestions for Developing a Campaign to Control
Yellow Fever, Am. J. Trop. M., 4: 277, 1924.

Outlines in detail methods for combatting yellow fever
which relate chiefly to mosquito proofing or destroying.
wells and containers of all sorts used in and near human
habitations for storing fresh water, as these are the chief
receptacles used by Stegomyia, the yellow fever mosquito,
for depositing eggs. Methods of computing the mosquito
index and checking up on the results of the work are
discussed. The mosquito index cannot be relied upon as proof
that the infection has been eradicated; a full year since
the last confirmed case of yellow fever has occurred must
elapse before there can be any cessation of mosquitto control
work.
